revised_title: Topochemical and Structural Correlation of Organic Crystals: Photoreactivity of Benzylidene-Butyrolactone and Benzylidenecyclopentanone
tldr: The authors studied the crystal structures of two organic compounds, -benzylidene-butyrolactone and 2-benzylidenecyclopentanone, to understand their solid-state photoreactivity. They found that the different photoreactivities of the compounds can be related to the extent of orbital overlap between potentially reactive double bonds in their crystal structures. The first compound undergoes topochemical photodimerization, while the second compound is photostable due to reduced orbital overlap.
